properties.name: openapi.validation.sample-rate
properties.description: Amount of traffic to be validated. Defaults to 0.001.

properties.name: openapi.validation.specification-file-path
properties.description: Path to the OpenAPI specification file. If set, the system will search for this file within resources and also as a path based on the current (working) directory. The property defaults to null. If null, the program searches for either an 'openapi.yaml/json' or a 'spec.yaml/json' file under resources.

properties.name: openapi.validation.excluded-paths
properties.description: Comma separated list of paths to be excluded from validation. Default is no excluded paths.

properties.name: openapi.validation.excluded-headers
properties.description: Headers with patterns to be excluded. e.g. `User-Agent: .*(bingbot|googlebot).*`. Default is no excluded paths.

properties.name: openapi.validation.validation-report-throttle-wait-seconds
properties.description: Number of seconds for which the validation report throttler will wait before sending the next report. The property defaults to null. If null or 0, there won't be any throttling.

properties.name: openapi.validation.validation-report-metric-name
properties.description: Metric name to be used when reporting violations with the MetricsReporter. The property defaults to 'openapi.validation.error'.

properties.name: openapi.validation.validation-report-metric-additional-tags
properties.description: Additional tags to be logged with metrics. They should be in the format {KEY}={VALUE},{KEY}={VALUE}. Default is no additional tags.

properties.name: openapi.validation.should-fail-on-request-violation
properties.description: If set to true the request will fail in case a request violation occurs. Defaults to false.

properties.name: openapi.validation.should-fail-on-response-violation
properties.description: If set to true the request will fail in case a response violation occurs. Defaults to false.
